title: Washer will not start at all
symptoms: No lights, no sound when Start is pressed
Outlet may still work for other devices
possible_causes: Faulty lid switch or door lock
Control board or main fuse failure
recommended_actions: Check outlet with another appliance
Verify power cord is fully inserted and not damaged
For top-load: try closing lid firmly; for front-load: listen for door lock click
If still dead, internal fuse or control board may need professional service

title: Washer fills with water but does not agitate
symptoms: Then silence or only humming sound
possible_causes: Faulty lid switch (machine thinks lid open)
recommended_actions: Pause and resume cycle to rule out electronics glitch
Listen for motor humming (belt may be broken if motor runs but tub does not move)
Avoid forcing washer; schedule technician to inspect belt/coupling

title: Washer not draining
symptoms: Water remains in tub at end of cycle
Sometimes error code for drain issue
recommended_actions: Locate and clean pump filter (front bottom panel on many front-load machines)
Check drain hose for kinks or clogs
Listen for pump sound; if it hums but no water exits, pump may be blocked or burned out

title: Washer not spinning / clothes come out very wet
symptoms: Washer completes cycle but clothes dripping
Spin stage seems weak or very short
possible_causes: Shock absorbers or suspension rods worn
recommended_actions: Redistribute heavy items and run an extra spin-only cycle
Make sure washer is level on the floor
If problem repeats with different loads, drive system may need service

title: Washer leaking water on the floor
symptoms: Water under or around the washer
Leak may occur only during fill, wash, or drain
possible_causes: Damaged door boot seal on front-loaders
recommended_actions: Tighten hot/cold water inlet hoses and check for drips
Inspect door gasket for tears or trapped clothing
Use HE detergent and correct amount to avoid excessive foam
If leak appears from inside cabinet, stop use and call technician

title: Washer making loud banging during spin
symptoms: Machine shakes and hits cabinet or walls
possible_causes: Shock absorbers or suspension springs worn
recommended_actions: Adjust legs so washer is solid and does not rock
Avoid mixing heavy items with very light ones
If banging continues even with small balanced loads, suspension parts need inspection

title: Washer smells like mold or mildew
symptoms: Smell stronger when door is closed for long time
possible_causes: Standing water in door seal or drain areas
Using only cold water and too much detergent
Not leaving door open to dry
recommended_actions: Run a hot cleaning cycle with washer cleaner or vinegar + baking soda
Clean rubber door seal gently with diluted bleach
Leave door ajar after each wash to dry interior

title: Error code for unbalanced load
symptoms: Tub full of heavy wet clothes
possible_causes: Too small or too large load
recommended_actions: Open washer, redistribute items and remove one or two heavy pieces
Run spin-only cycle
If code appears with almost every load, check leveling and suspension

title: Washer door will not unlock
symptoms: Cycle completed but door stays locked
possible_causes: Control board still senses water in drum
recommended_actions: Wait several minutes after cycle end; many machines have delay
Run a short drain/spin program
If still locked, unplug washer for 5–10 minutes then try again
Use manual emergency release if available (see manual)

title: Washer fills endlessly and overflows
symptoms: Water continues flowing even when correct level reached
You may hear water entering even when machine is off
recommended_actions: Turn off water supply valves immediately
Unplug washer
This issue usually requires replacement of inlet valve or pressure sensor by a technician

title: Washer trips circuit breaker
symptoms: Breaker trips during wash or spin
Machine may fill with water before trip
possible_causes: Heater element short (on machines with internal heater)
recommended_actions: Do not repeatedly reset breaker
Unplug washer and inspect cord and outlet
Contact appliance electrician; internal components must be tested

title: Clothes not getting clean
symptoms: Residue or detergent left on fabrics
possible_causes: Using too much or wrong type of detergent
Very short or cold cycles only
recommended_actions: Use HE detergent and correct dose for load size
Do not overfill drum; leave space for clothes to tumble
Use warmer water and longer cycles for heavily soiled items
Run regular maintenance wash with cleaner

title: Washer makes grinding noise when spinning
symptoms: Sometimes small water leak from rear
possible_causes: Foreign object between drum and tub
recommended_actions: Stop using washer to avoid further damage
Drum bearing replacement is major repair often requiring expert
Consider cost vs age of machine

title: Washer displays error for low water flow
recommended_actions: Fully open both hot and cold valves
Turn off water, disconnect hoses, and clean small filter screens inside valve ports
Avoid using other large water appliances during wash

title: Detergent drawer full of water after cycle
symptoms: Water remains in detergent or softener compartment
recommended_actions: Remove drawer and clean all parts under warm water
Check small siphon caps are not blocked
Push drawer firmly until it clicks

title: Washer pauses repeatedly and takes too long
symptoms: Cycle time extends much longer than display
possible_causes: Sensor trying to correct unbalanced load
recommended_actions: Wash similar fabrics together
Use smaller loads
If time extension happens on almost every cycle, suspension parts should be checked

title: Burning rubber smell during spin
possible_causes: Object caught between tub and drum
recommended_actions: Stop cycle and unplug washer
Do not continue to use until belt and motor area inspected
Possible fire risk if ignored

title: Top-load washer agitator not moving bottom clothes
symptoms: Clothes on top move, bottom stays still
recommended_actions: Remove fabric softener cap and inspect plastic dogs
Replace agitator repair kit (inexpensive parts)
Follow service manual for disassembly

title: Front-load washer door leaks during wash
symptoms: Water drips from front of door
possible_causes: Damaged or dirty door boot seal
Objects stuck between glass and gasket
Washer overloaded so clothes push against door
recommended_actions: Clean gasket completely and remove coins, hair, or debris
Check for tears or cracks; replace boot if damaged
Use smaller loads to reduce pressure on door

title: Washer beeps and refuses to start (child lock)
symptoms: Buttons make sound but nothing happens
possible_causes: Control panel locked to prevent children from using machine
recommended_actions: Hold specified button combination (for example, Temp + Spin) for 3–5 seconds to unlock (see manual)
After unlock, restart cycle
